conclusion: There are four objects above the slabs, which are illuminated by a light source, casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
When the light source moves to the back left, the shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the front right.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadows will shift to the front left.
Shadows are cast opposite to the direction of the light source.
When the light source moves further away from the objects, the shadows will become larger.
The angle of the light rays hitting the objects becomes more acute when the light source moves further away.
When the light source moves closer to the objects, the shadows will become smaller.
When the light source moves to the back left or right, the shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the opposite side and change in size.
Shadows become larger when the light source moves further away and smaller when it moves closer.
